channel.title: Bookmarks Podcast
channel.description: Daily audio notes generated from Thanh's saved reading/bookmarks (Instapaper today; more sources later). Unlisted feed.
channel.itunes:author: Thanh Pham

item.title: The Lean Agent Stack — OpenClaw for Finance, Context Without Limits, and Shipping From Your Bedroom
item.description: OpenClaw as a personal finance operator, the five-pattern context architecture that keeps your agent lean at 24/7, and why the startup stack from your bedroom is now a solved problem — the only remaining bottleneck is taste.

item.title: Evals Over Vibes — OpenClaw vs Manus, Claude Code, and the New Baseline for Shipping
item.description: Why agent ops is moving from vibe-based automation to eval-driven reliability: platform choices matter less than runbooks, coding agents shift the bottleneck to constraints, and OpenAI Evals gives you a practical regression loop.

item.title: Launchd over Cron — Mission Statements, Skill Architecture, and SOP-to-Workflow Agents
item.description: Why agent ops is shifting from ‘more tools’ to boring reliability: use OS-level scheduling, give agents a north-star mission, and turn SOPs into structured workflows you can audit and improve.

item.title: Intent over Nodes — Workflow Replacement, Email Agents, and Alert-to-Action Ops
item.description: Why intent-driven agents are replacing brittle node graphs: turn workflow exports into reliable jobs, build email triage that defaults to drafts, and convert noisy alerts into contextual incidents with governed runbooks.

item.title: Taste Is the New Bottleneck — Memory Hygiene + Auth Sanity for Real Agent Ops
item.description: When execution gets cheap, taste and ops discipline become the edge: transcript ingestion, persistent browser auth, and nightly memory hygiene for reliable agent workflows.

item.title: The Agent Infrastructure Tipping Point: When 100% Becomes the New Normal
item.description: Fresh research from Anthropic shows 100% of enterprises plan to expand AI agent adoption in 2026. Apple ships Xcode 26.3 with native agentic coding. We're past the tipping point—agents are now infrastructure.

item.title: The Enterprise Agent Tipping Point: OpenAI Frontier and the Production Reality Check
item.description: OpenAI launches Frontier, CrewAI reports 100% of enterprises expanding agent adoption, 86% deploying to production. The conversation shifted from "can we?" to "how do we do this well?" This is the week agents went mainstream.

item.title: Agent Memory Systems: Building Persistent Context for Production AI
item.description: Session memory isn't enough — production agents need layered, persistent memory with semantic search, clear write permissions, and regular maintenance. The difference between demos and production.

item.title: Agent Reliability Engineering: Moving AI Agents from Demo to Production
item.description: Error handling, observability, idempotency, and production-ready patterns for AI automation that runs unsupervised. The reliability engineering discipline for agents.

item.title: The Rise of the Agentic Operating System & Human-on-the-Loop
item.description: IBM and Deloitte predict a shift to "Agentic Operating Systems" where specialized agents are orchestrated by humans in an "on-the-loop" supervisory role, matching our own OpenClaw architecture.

item.title: Building Production-Ready Agent Workflows: From Prototype to Reliable Automation
item.description: Moving beyond toy demos: state management, idempotency, observability, failure modes, and testing strategies for production-grade AI automation.

item.title: OpenClaw Security Whiplash: what to do when your agent goes viral
item.description: A practical playbook for agent ops: contain prompt injection, skills supply-chain risk, and accidental public exposure as OpenClaw goes mainstream.

item.title: OpenClaw Goes Mainstream - What the CNBC Coverage and Security Research Tell Us
item.description: Analysis of OpenClaw's viral moment: CNBC coverage, security research from Trend Micro, and what it means for agent operations and AI workshops.

item.title: OpenClaw 2026.2.6: Cron reliability + security scanner (Feb 7)
item.description: Cron reliability fixes, a new skill/plugin safety scanner, and other ops-focused changes that make agent deployments more trustworthy.

item.title: Control Planes for Agents: Observability + Identity + Context (Feb 6)
item.description: Three shifts that make agent deployments safer and more repeatable: traces-as-control-plane, first-class agent identities, and repo-local context packs.

item.title: The Agentic Enterprise Reality Check (Feb 5)
item.description: Why agentic AI deployments are running into identity sprawl, data readiness, and governance/observability constraints.

item.title: Two Signals for Agentic AI in 2026: Dev Taste + Security Standards (Feb 2)
item.description: Fallback research update episode.

item.title: Reliable AI Workflows with Agentic Primitives & Context Engineering (Feb 1)
item.description: Summary of GitHub’s three-layer framework for making AI workflows reliable with Markdown structure, agentic primitives, and context engineering.

item.title: Autonomous AI Agents: OpenClaw, Ralph Loops, and Enterprise Control Towers (Jan 31)
item.description: Research-driven episode on the shift from chatbots to agents that act, plus why governance and consumption pricing are the next battleground.

item.title: Agentic Enterprise Meets Personal Agent Workflows (Feb 4)
item.description: Sources: MuleSoft Q1 2026 roadmap; Dev.to AI roundup; Humai AI agents guide.

item.title: Today’s Research Update — Agents, OpenClaw, and AI Coding (Jan 31)
item.description: Fallback research update episode.

item.title: Agent Evals in the Real World: Traces, CI Gates, and DevSecOps Context (Jan 30)
item.description: Fallback research update episode.

item.title: Clawdbot Runs Locally: The Messaging-First Personal AI Assistant (Jan 29)
item.description: Research update episode.

item.title: Today’s Research Update — Agents, Models, and Momentum (Jan 28)
item.description: Fallback research update episode.

item.title: Dario Amodei — The Adolescence of Technology
item.description: Instapaper audio note summary (Laura).

item.title: How I Use Clawdbot (Kristian Freeman)
item.description: A practical field report on turning a chat interface into an always-on control plane using skills, model routing, and tight trust boundaries.

item.title: Clawdbot: The Future of Personal AI Assistants (MacStories)
item.description: A hands-on look at why chat-based agents become real assistants only when they can reliably execute workflows through tools and skills.

item.title: AI Will Change Private Markets (Colossus)
item.description: A Bloomberg-Terminal-style argument for how AI will compress diligence and synthesis, reshaping private-market workflows and strategies.

item.title: Compound Engineering (Every)
item.description: A practical workflow for shipping with coding agents: Plan → Work → Assess → Compound, with compounding coming from capturing learnings so future agents don’t repeat mistakes.
